byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: American officials say Obama administration plans to sell eight new F-16 fighter jets to Pakistan, in overture intended to foster closer partnership with Islamabad; Pakistan is seen as key non-NATO ally in peace process between Afghanistan government and Taliban.
lead_paragraph: A deal intended to boost the nation’s partnership with the Pakistanis in a time of strain, and of concern about Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal.

headline.main: U.S. Set to Sell Fighter Jets to Pakistan, Balancing Pressure on Nawaz Sharif
headline.print_headline: White House Set to Sell New Fighter Jets to Pakistan in Bid to Bolster Partnership

snippet: A deal intended to boost the nation’s partnership with the Pakistanis in a time of strain, and of concern about Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
